details.title: Comparison of two theories of angle glint: polarization considerations
details.abstract: Angle glint can be explained as distortions in the radar echo signal phase front, or alternatively, deviations of the direction of power flow from the radial direction. Here we show that these two theories yield identical results when the polarization of the scattered waves and the receiving antenna are considered.
details.journal_title: IEEE Transactions on Aerospace and Electronic Systems
